house_rules.aditional:
1. No shoes in the Airstream.

2. No throwing trash over safely railings.

3. Do not wipe any cleaning materials on the inner and outer surfaces of the Airstream as it scratches easily, so no sponge wiping please. Any damage to the Airstream surface/drapes/upholstery, inside or out, will be charged at the cost of repair and time.

4. Off grid system:
We turn off AC power supply during sleeping hours (between midnight to 8AM). During this time everything in the Airstream will work normally except TV, Microwave, and AC power outlets. 

If you require AC power during midnight to 8am, please let us know prior booking so that we may make arrangements.

5. For events or commercial photography contact us prior booking.

6. One complementary firewood bundle is provided inside the fire pit.
There are additional firewood bundles available for purchase. We will send you a payment request after your check out if you have purchased and used any of these items during your stay.

7. Total number of guests and pets must be registered with your booking. Unauthorized/unregistered guests, pets, vehicles will incur $50 fee per occurrence.

location_descriptions.title: Neighbourhood highlights
location_descriptions.content:
Half moon bay, the nearest town, has a Safeway, Starbucks etc for groceries, take a left at the McDonalds.

Main street also in HMB, it has lots of little eateries and shops to explore and has an old California charm. For lunch or dinner we recommend Sam’s Chowder house also in HMB, especially the back patio.

Tunitas Beach, a 2 min drive away south, is beautiful for a walk if you get a chance we recommend it. When you park look for the lane that leads down to the beach, you will have to go around a fence to get there but it is worst it.

See guide book for more information on local hidden gems.

description:
One of a kind Airstream overlooking a stunning beach, Pacific Ocean and California Coastline, perched high on a cliff to create an unforgettable magical experience of a lifetime.

If you can’t find availability for the date you are interested, check out our second newer unit here
https://www.airbnb.com/h/luxurycaliforniacoastairstream

The space
New 22 ' Airstream Bambi, sleeps up to 4 people, ideally 2 adults and 2 children or 3 Adults.

2 adults fit comfortably on the spacious queen size bed with bay window.

2 children ( 6 and above) or 1 mid size adult on convertible bed located in the dinette area

Full shower and bathroom with hot-water.

24 inch TV with Roku with Netflix account

Fast Wifi

Full kitchen with microwave and fridge, pots, pans and utensils. Pour-over coffee. Dishes for 4 people, including wine and drinking glasses.

Outdoor living area consists of large fire pit with 4 seats.

BBQ and dining table that seats 6.

Pizza Oven.

One complimentary Firewood bundle is provided with each booking. (Additional paid firewood available at $20 per bundle).

Note: Children of age 6 and above allowed, however each child should be able to follow safety instructions and be supervised at all times via an adult.

Guest access
You will have full private access to this one of a kind location. Automatic gates will open and close for ease of access, parking a few feet from the Airstream.

house_rules.aditional:
Trespassing- Please enjoy our property but make sure to avoid entering the neighboring properties.

Quiet Time- Please be respectful of the quiet mountain community. Neighborhood quiet hours are between 10:00 PM - 8:00 AM.

Septic System- Only toilet paper and human waste should be flushed. Please no food scraps or grease down drains.

Energy & Water Conservation- Conserve energy by turning off appliances and lights when not in use, turning down the thermostat when leaving and refraining from running water unnecessarily.

Hot Tub- Available all year round. Please make sure to close cover after using.

Fire Safety- No outdoor fires, fireworks, charcoal grills or open flames. Outdoor gas firepit and gas grill is provided.

Smoking- No smoking, vaping or e-cigarettes in the house. Please respect the environment and fire risks by disposing of cigarette butts properly.

Firearms- Please do not fire weapons on the property.

Checking out- Please check out by 10:00 AM. Please place any used towels or linens in the laundry room. Please load and start dishwasher if there are any dirty dishes. Please bag trash and recyclables and place in garage.

location_descriptions.title: Neighbourhood highlights
location_descriptions.content:
The home is located in a quiet mountain community away from the hustle and bustle of city life. Home sits at 3,930 ft elevation and borders the Sierra National Forest with 4x4 , off-roading and hiking trails closeby.

Mariposa, CA is a historic city founded in 1849 during the California gold rush.
Downtown Mariposa has kept with this history, offering unique shopping, restaurants, bars and breweries, all while maintaining the old western charm.

house_rules.aditional:
ALL PARTIES OR EVENTS MUST BE DISCLOSED AND APPROVED PRIOR TO BOOKING. THIS INCLUDES BIRTHDAYS, BACHELOR/BACHELORETTE/ENGAGEMENT, WEDDINGS AND SO FORTH

-All guests must be included in reservation including NON-OVER NIGHT GUESTS

- Guests MUST book BOTH Friday and Saturday night when booking the weekend unless consent is given from host prior to booking.

-Pool Heating/Jacuzzi: There is a pool heating fee if you elect to heat the pool. In the rare event of a pool-spa equipment/heater malfunction, we will make every effort to resolve it as quickly as possible. If a malfunction occurs, the pool heating fee will be refunded for the days impacted, but there are no refunds given on rent monies. Heating fees vary depending on time of year and length of stay. For check in dates 4/1-10/15 (warmer months) with reservations greater than 3 nights, the fee is 200$ per night and $250 per night if 3 nights or less. For reservations with check in dates of 10/16-11/30, 3/1-3/31 (Colder months) The fee is 300$ per night regardless of length of stay. For checks in from 12/1-2/28 the fee is $600 for the first night and $300 for each additional night. If guests wish to only heat the jacuzzi the fee is 100$ per night year-round. Guests must opt to heat the pool/spa for all nights of their reservation if opting into heating. 

-Pet Fee: 50$ per night per pet fee if bringing pets, this covers 1 pet. Each additional pet is 25$ per night. This fee also applies to service animals because service animals create just as much mess and liability as non-service animals.

-Service Animals: Hey create the same amount of mess as a non-service animal. Therefore, a pet fee still applies. There is a flat rate of $150 per say for service animal(s).

-Service people are permitted to access the outside of the property and pool to perform their weekly maintenance duties.

-System(s), Furnishing, or Amenity Disruptions: In the event the property experiences a failure of a system, including but not limited to water, sewer, septic, electrical, gas, plumbing, mechanical, appliances, heat pump, ventilating, pool or spa heating, or other structural systems, furnishings or amenities, owners will make every reasonable effort to repair or replace the failed system or equipment. The property owner shall not be liable to Guests for damages, and no refunds will be given for such failures.

-Disclaimer: The Homeowners/managers are not responsible for any accidents, injuries or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities including with the use of the pool or hot tub and guests choose to use the pool or hot tub at their own risk. The Homeowners/managers are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the guest. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises and facilities/amenities or others whom they invite to use the premise facilities/amenities and agree to abide by the House Rules. 

-No confetti. If confetti are left behind at the property an additional cleaning fee of $250 will apply.

-Any party decorations not properly disposed of or left behind at the property such as tape on the walls or ceilings will result in an additional cleaning fee of $250. 

-NO DJs or COMMERCIAL SPEAKERS AT ANYTIME UNLESS CONSENT IS GIVEN BY HOST.

images.title: Giant lake size gas heated pool, LED color changing lights, with tons of floaties and some of the best views in the county.
Wake up above the clouds! One of the most magical experiences is when you're looking down on the clouds in the morning while enjoying the perfectly heated 8 person hot tub.
Amazing drone shot of the 7 acre 4000 sq ft property with epic sunsets and sky. Truely a one-of-a-kind property, completely private yet still close to all major attractions.
Giant fire pit connected to gas line (never runs out of gas), with seating for easily 12. Large sliding doors lead to the family room for very convenient and easy access.
10 person hot tub with extra strong jets, throw in a flamingo for double the fun.
Take in those views while you enjoy the perfectly heated, large elevated hot tub.
This is the view you get when your hanging pool and spa side. Beautiful Welks Resort off yonder, perfectly manicured 18 hole golf course with lakes, better sky and mountain range than Palm Springs.
Best view and best vanishing edge pool in San Diego! Come and enjoy!
Massive pool and fun for the whole family.
Go from VIP lounge cabana to our 7' deep pool or hang on the infinity edge and enjoy some of the best views in San Diego.
Massive colorful LED lighted swimming pool with waterfall and floaties, VIP lounge cabana in the background.
Enjoy a cold glass of champagne and take in the breath-taking views.
Lounge poolside or jump in and take a dip under the waterfalls.
Roaring fire pit with seating for 12+ Best seats in the house are in the rocking chairs overlooking the view and feeling the warmth of the fire.
Play corn hole, ping pong or other games while enjoying a beer overlooking Mountains, golf courses and resorts.
Enjoy a meal and a view with seating for 16+ directly next to custom outdoor built-in grill. One of my favorite places to have dinner with friends and family.
Brand new top of the line and easy to use and light Bull Grill, custom built kitchen (2021), LED under lights and a modern finishing touch.
Enjoy a round of mini golf situated directly next to our large outdoor dining space.
Giant family room with 75" Roku tv, air hockey and pool table, modern comfy sofas, vaulted ceiling and tons of natural light.
Tons of entertainment in our family room with floor to ceiling windows, mountain views and tons of natural light pouring in.
Pool and air hockey my two favorite games.
Large rustic dining table with seating for 12.

Large rustic dining table is adjacent to the family room for convenience and modern open feel. 12 could comfortably sit here with 3 carry over seats on the counter table by the painting. The dining room can seat a grand total of 15.
Giant kitchen island and high-end Italian gas range stove.
Chefs' kitchen and stove with many gas burners and two ovens.
Huge chefs' kitchen with custom mahogany African wedge cabinetry
Biggest island I've ever sat and eaten at, and even has its own sink.
Breakfast nook with more mountain views.
Open concept living room with oversized comfy sofa with chaise and foosball table.
Large reclining chairs, 75" Roku TV, modern art, foosball, family games.
Regulation size 56" top of the line foosball. Who want to play!?
Dreams Taste Like Cotton Candy! Who's ready for some foosball and more family and friend's games then you know what to do with!
Martinis anyone? Our custom bar is adjacent to our living room.
Custom bar with martinis and shakers.
Timeless custom bar with two faucets sinks with mini fridge. Bartenders' guidebook and martini instructions included.
Grand master bedroom with vaulted ceilings and king bed.
Relax on your memory foam king bed and watch 65" Roku Tv or stare out the floor to ceiling sliding glass door and take a look at the beautiful mountains.
Master bedroom includes twin size day bed with twin size trundle.
Study nook located inside the master bedroom is the perfect place to work or study while vacationing. It has tons of natural light and beautiful pool views.
Huge ensuite master bathroom, his and her sink, giant tub with beautiful side mountain and landscape views.
Giant tub and custom shower for two. Enjoy amazing side mountain and landscape views while soaking in the tub.
Guest bedroom comfortably sleeps 4 with two full beds and cute reading nook.
Custom full common area restroom with beautiful stand-up shower.
Rustic guest bedroom with queen size bunk bed and twin-size day bed. Comfortably sleeps 5 adults.
Enjoy our very comfy memory foam queen size bunk beds.
Tasteful and rustic guest bedroom easily sleeps 5.
Common area half bathroom conveniently located next to dining room and tastefully furnished.
Designated laundry room with oversize washer and dryer makes doing laundry a breeze.

location_descriptions.title: Neighbourhood highlights
location_descriptions.content: The property is located on the top of the mountain directly across from Welks Resort, so there are sweeping mountain, resort and golf course views. There is complete privacy from all areas of the property inside and out, with currently no neighbors, so there are no concerns of petty noise complaints, or arbitrary restrictions on the property that lesson the fun of a vacation. The property sits directly off the 15 freeway, which makes getting around to SD's top destinations and the beach a breeze!

location_descriptions.content: It's recommended to use personal vehicles or schedule shuttles for pickup/drop off. Ride sharing apps also work well!

description:
Stunning hilltop estate with 4k of living space sitting on 7 acres with breath taking mountain, golf course and resort views! Great Lake size vanishing edge gas heated pool, Niagara Falls size waterfall and 8 person hot tub makes you feel like you left earth and traveled to paradise! The utmost privacy where friends and family can let loose and have a good time with out having to worry about neighbors complaining yet still only 20-40 minutes from all of SD’s top attractions. Don’t miss out!

Guest access
Guests have access to the entire property with the exception of the 3 car attached garage. There is ample parking even without the garage. Guests can access all of the property's amenities such as the pool, fire pit, jacuzzi etc 24 hours per day.

Other things to note
-We normally provide only 1 roll of paper towels per visit
-There are extra fees for pool/jacuzzi heating and if bringing pets
-Service Animals: They create the same amount of mess as a non-service animal. Therefore, a pet fee still applies.
-Our 3rd bathroom is a half bathroom with just sink and toilet
-Pool heating brings the pool to approximately 80 degrees depending on time of day and jacuzzi to approximately 102
-pool inflatables are not a guaranteed amenity and are for staging purposes only
-Service people are permitted to access the outside of the property and pool to perform their weekly maintenance duties.

location_descriptions.content: If you rent a car, there's plenty of free street parking, and I have 6 beach cruisers & 2 skateboards available! Uber & Lyft is also a car service that can drive you anywhere you want to go! There are also electric scooters & bicycles everywhere that you can rent by the minute & they go really fast! Bird, Lime & Jump are the companies that have free Apps that you’ll need to download into your phone in order to rent electric scooters or bikes.

description:
You have a charming Spanish 1926 architecture pool house. It’s located in the back of my house with all of the amenities necessary to enjoy your stay.

***MUST LOVE DOGS: I have 1 small friendly dog that lives with me in my house in front, I will keep him inside for the most part while you are here, but he will be around.

The space
This listing is for 2 adults only. This is a studio with 1 queen bed. Your bathroom is outside, but fenced in with a surfboard door and private.
The pool house is 7 blocks to the beach, about a 15 minute walk, or 5 minute bike ride to the beach. Abbot Kinney Blvd has the coolest shopping & some excellent restaurants to explore.

Guest access
-Private gated keyless entrance
-Washer & dryer
-Unique outdoor cabaña with fire pit next to pool for hangout
-outdoor dining area with fire pit
-pool use depends on if you can swim
-free access to bikes, boogie boards & skateboards!
- Hot tub takes 45 minutes to heat up & is available upon request. Arrangements need to be made ahead of time.
- Natural gas BBQ

Other things to note
There is plenty of free street parking. Just pay attention to street cleaning days so you don't get a street cleaning ticket ! Tickets are $73.00!

house_rules.aditional: - RENTAL AGREEMENT Please read this before reserving our property: There are to be absolutely no parties or outside guests other than those stated clearly in your reservation. By booking our property, you are agreeing to the contract below in its entirety Guest agrees to comply with all Terms and Conditions stated below, which are an essential part of this Agreement; Guest acknowledges he/she has read, understands, and is familiar with all Terms and Conditions. Other occupants will be family members, friends or responsible children, as listed in the Guest Information above. Children must be supervised by at least one responsible adult at all times. Use of the premises will be denied to persons not falling within the foregoing categories, and as a result they would have to vacate the Unit immediately without any refund. No keys will be issued to anyone who is not an adult. Guest agrees not to sublet or assign any portion of the premises. For the purposes of this Agreement, Owner and/or Manager will consider that there is a party inside the Unit whenever the number of daytime occupants in the Unit exceeds the number of guests outlined in the reservation. Notwithstanding the former provision, even if the number of guests is not exceeded, all other common definitions of a party will be accepted, whenever the noise level inside the Unit is beyond what is reasonably accepted as normal. Guest, all occupants of the Unit, and all other persons from time to time present in the Unit, are responsible for their own safety and should maintain a safe environment while in the Unit by locking doors, windows, garage doors, setting alarms if provided, etc., when appropriate to do so. Guest is encouraged to secure the appropriate travelers or vacation insurance and/or renters insurance, if such coverage is desired. Neither do Owner and Manager accept liability for any inconvenience arising from any temporary defects or stoppage in supply of water, gas, electricity or plumbing. CHECK IN: Unless agreed differently by the Manager in writing, check-in is any time after 3:00 PM. Manager will send Guest the instructions for a self check-in. GUEST'S LIABILITY: Guest agrees to accept liability for any damages caused to the property (other than normal wear and tear) by Guest, including, but not limited to, landscaping, misuse of appliances, and/or equipment furnished. location_descriptions.title: Neighbourhood highlights
location_descriptions.content:
A dream location with breath taking views. It starts from the moment you enter your Malibu getaway, from early morning sunrise, to spectacular sunsets and magical moon beams across the ocean floor.

Relax on the deck, walk on the sand, surf, kayak, Kite Surfing, and swimming are steps from your front door.

The location is fantastic feeling a million miles away from the city but close enough if you need it. Santa Monica and Malibu town centers 10 mins either way. LAX airport 40 mins. Public bus stop a minute away. "Moonshadows" and "Duke's" restaurants just down the beach.

description:
Enjoy this Malibu Beach House. This 3 Bedroom/2 Bath House is perfect for a romantic getaway or for those looking to relax for the weekend. Enjoy the panoramic views of the Santa Monica Bay and the sunsets are not to be missed.

A short drive or bike ride to all the shopping and dining Malibu has to offer. In addition to the beach, there are lots of trails and wine tasting nearby.

The space
Your stay at our beach house will be an experience you will not forget.

After you enter the house, you walk down the hallway into the open air living room/kitchen complete with ocean views, and a breathtaking chandler.

The Kitchen features an island with banquet seating, stainless appliances, and a tile mosaic backsplash; complete with white quartz countertops and contemporary white cabinetry. There is a basic coffee pot in the kitchen if you would like to bring your own coffee.

The living room has a plush L-shaped couch and a mounted flat screen television. Open the sliding glass door and walk out onto the private balcony overlooking the Santa Monica Bay, with views of the Pier and Point Dume. The sunsets off the deck are not to be missed.

Off the living room is the Master suite. It features a King sized bed, large closet, mounted flat screen television for your own streaming services and an ocean view. The bathroom features a double vanity, a claw foot bathtub and a large shower complete with an ocean view.

There are also two other private bedrooms each with mounted flat screen televisions, and closet space.

The house has a washer and dryer, and leads to your private access to the beach. The property also features central air conditioning and heating. The house is equipped with hand soap and dish soap but we do not provide toiletries such as shampoo and conditioner.

Guest access
You will have access to the entire house. You can access the beach via a door in the garage that leads you down to the ocean.

The beach below is a wet beach and is dangerous to access during certain tide situations. Please understand this is not a public beach that is suitable for small children, novice swimmers, elders, or anyone who is uneasy on their feet. There are a ton of public beaches nearby we can recommend!

Please note that the garage is not available for parking. And stairs are required to access the beach.

location_descriptions.title: Neighbourhood highlights
location_descriptions.content:
ARMSTRONG REDWOODS
Drive: ~30 minutes
In Sonoma County's Armstrong Redwoods State Natural Reserve, walk among sprouting ferns and giant trees in the magnificence of nature. Beneath the soaring redwood canopy, you'll feel silenced by the trees' majesty and humbled by their endurance of more than a thousand years.

BODEGA HEAD
Drive: ~35 minutes
Jutting out into the Pacific Ocean, the small rocky peninsula known as Bodega Head offers stunning bluff top vistas, enticing trails, beach access, and abundant wildlife viewing, from seabirds to seals and migrating whales.

MOONSHINE ROAD
Walk: ~10 minutes
Going up the driveway and to the main road, take a left on Burnside. After about .5 miles, on your right you’ll reach the beginning of the gravel road called “Moonshine.” Soak in the stunning views of our back yard with this 1.5 mile walk to the end of the road.

Be sure to go to downtown Sebastopol's Barlow where you'll find dozens of restaurants and local shops.

location_descriptions.title: Getting around
location_descriptions.content: There is parking on site in a gated property. Maximum of two cars. Ride share is not popular in Sebastopol; I'd recommend renting a car to get the best of Sonoma County.

description:
Welcome to our private, renovated, personal spa in the woods. Including a large wood-burning Finnish sauna, it features a picturesque deck with hot/cold plunge over breathtaking untouched forest with fire pit vineyard-side. This all-cedar cottage is nested below Halleck Vineyard, one of Sonoma County’s prestigious wineries. A perfect retreat, you are centrally located for the best Sonoma has to offer

Sonoma County Wine Tastings (0-20 mins)
Bodega Bay (20 mins)
Armstrong Giant Redwoods (30 mins)

The space
** Please note while booking, to access the lodge and bedroom loft, you’ll need to go up and down stairs. Not ideal for older guests **

Enjoy a full private forest and a large Finnish sauna in our newly renovated vineyard retreat. While staying at the lodge I hope you can enjoy a long sauna, take a hot bath, and star gaze from the fire pit.

While staying at the lodge, join us up at the main house for a full wine tasting of Halleck Vineyard wines paired with local cheeses crafted for the best tasting experience in Sonoma County ($65/person). After the tasting, go down to the lodge and soak in the picturesque views of the private untouched forest under our heated back deck.

Working remotely? The lodge has ultra-fast internet to carry you through any zoom call or remote-working scenario.

Take advantage of the outdoor shower on the back deck after a warm cup of complimentary French press coffee. Please note this shower and bath are the only shower and bath available on the property, there is no indoor shower.

This lodge is designed to unplug, relax, and soak in the simple life on a vineyard. Our brand new full kitchen has everything you need to unwind for as long as you need. Please be aware, to access the lodge and bedroom loft, you’ll need to go up and down stairs.

There is also an electric car charger available. :)

Hope to see you soon!

This property is part of Halleck Vineyard, a separate business. For that reason, we do not allow events or parties on the premises. With our limited parking and shared space, if you wish to host any event, wedding, or party, we do have certain fees for such inquiry.

Other things to note
FEATURES & AMENITIES
Wood-burning Finnish Sauna
Vineyard-Side Fire pit
Large 2 acre private forest view
Outdoor Shower
Fully equipped kitchen (no oven)
Hammock
French Press
High Speed Wi-Fi
Record Player

house_rules.aditional:
Dear Guest,
Apart from the San Bernardino County Ordinance 4371 enforced rules and regulations (see below) the following house rules apply. By accepting the online reservation you acknowledge that you have read and accepted these terms: 

CHECK-IN
Check-in time is 3 pm. 

CHECK-OUT
Check-out time is 11am. 

NO SMOKING
No smoking is permitted in the house or close to the entrances or windows. Cigarette filters need to be discarded in an appropriate and safe manner. Wetted down in a fire resistant container. Cigarette filters are a potential fire hazard. Disregarding these restrictions will result in a fine and a report to Airbnb.

PAYMENT POLICY
Owner will accept payments issued via Airbnb.

CLEANING
The property will be inspected, cleaned and sanitized after each guest’s departure so that the guest can enjoy his or her vacation up to the last moment. Guest agrees to leave the property in the same general condition it was received. 

PETS
Apart from the San Bernardino County ordinance requirements we ask our guests to keep pets off furniture. 

CLEANING
The property will be inspected, cleaned and sanitized after each guest’s departure so that the guest can enjoy his or her vacation up to the last moment. Guest agrees to leave the property in the same general condition it was received. 

CHIMINEA: 
See the rules under the San Bernardino ordinance. 

HOT TUB 

Some safety rules for the tub:

Soaking for too long in elevated temperatures can raise body heat to hazardous levels. A safe soaking time should not exceed 15 minutes. 
Some medical authorities have recommended a lower temperature of 100° to 102°. They advice that since infants and children are more sensitive to heat, they should be exposed to water of not more that 95°, for no more than 10 minutes. Consult with your family doctor. 
Persons with heart disease, diabetes, high blood pressure, or any other serious illness should not enter the spa or hot tub without first consulting with, and obtaining the advice of a physician. 
Pregnant women should not enter a hot tub or spa without first consulting with their physician and following the doctor’s advice.

IMPROPER USE OF PREMISES
Guest will not 
Allow overnight occupancy of the unit the number of guests stated on the reservation confirmation,
Use the premises for any illegal activity, including but not limited to possession, serving or consumption of alcoholic beverages by or to persons less than 21 years of age,
Cause damage to the premises rented or to any of the neighboring properties,
Use the premises in any manner that interferes with the neighbors’ rights to quiet and enjoyment of their property.
In any case of improper use of the premises, the Guest and any other occupants may be required to vacate the premises and forfeit the rental fee. Airbnb will be informed about the misuse and further action will be determined. 

DAMAGE TO THE PREMISE
Airbnb Rental
Any damage to the property will be reported to Airbnb. . 
The Airbnb host coverage may cover any damages to the rental property and it’s furnishings if it was due to an accident caused by the guest. 
However, should the amount not be covered by Airbnb by the given amount the guest remains liable for the balance. The homeowner shall provide the guest with an itemized statement of any charges. 

LIABILITY
I recognize and acknowledge that there are certain risks of physical injury to guests and their party which may occur on the premises of the Joshua Tree Green Haus (JTGH), including but not limited to injuries associated with the hot tubs, and I agree to assume the full risk of any such injuries, damages or loss, regardless of the severity, which I or my child/ ward may sustain as a result of participating in any activities connected or associated with any such use of the facility. 
I waive and relinquish all claims I or my child/ ward may have against the owners of the JTGH, agents, servants or employees as a result of personal injury suffered while on the JTGH premises.
I hereby fully release and discharge Richard and Daniela Hammond from any and all claims from injuries, damage or loss which I or my child/ ward may have or which may accrue to me or my child/ ward on account of my utilization or the utilization of my child/ war in any of the JTGH facilities. I further agree to indemnify and hold harmless and defend the JTGH from any and all claims resulting from injuries, damages and losses sustained by me or by my child/ ward, and arising out, connected with, or in any way associated with the owners of the JTGH and its facilities. 


San Bernardino CO. Ordinance 4371:
The following information is in accordance with the San Bernardino County Ordinance 4371 (Short-Term Residential Rental Standards). By accepting the online reservation you acknowledge that you have read and accepted these terms: 

USE OF PROPERTY
This property shall not be used for commercial activity, including but not limited to weddings, wedding receptions, corporate retreats, business meeting or conference, filming photography shoots, a fraternity party, or any similar gathering unless regulated under an approved county-issued permit. 

PETS
No person shall have, keep, or maintain any dog on the property, unless he or she is able to provide proof of a current license issued by the County or other applicable municipal agency. No person owning or having control of any animal shall permit such animal to stray or run at large upon any unenclosed area on or off the short-term rental property. No person may bring his or her dog off a short-term rental property unless the dog is restrained by a leash and the person is competent to restrain the dog, or the dog is properly restrained and enclosed in a vehicle, cage, or similar enclosure. Any person owning or having control of any animal shall not allow said animal to create excessive noise. 

NUISANCE BEHAVIOR
Users are prohibited from disturbing the peace of the surrounding neighborhood and doing so is a violation of County Code and the rental agreement. It is unlawful to make, cause to be made, or allow to be made, either willfully or through failure to exercise control, any loud, excessive, impulsive, or intrusive noise that disturbs the peace or quiet or that causes discomfort or annoyance to any reasonable person of normal sensitivities in the area. Such types of noises or actions causing noises include, but are not limited to, yelling, shouting, hooting, whistling, singing, playing a musical instrument, emitting or transmitting any loud music or noise from any mechanical or electrical sound making or sound amplifying device, and the habitual barking, howling, or crowing of animals.

MAXIMUM OCCUPATION: 6 
PARKING LIMITATIONS: 3 No on-street parking.

PENALTIES FOR VIOLATION
Failure to comply with the requirements of Ordinance 4371, including but not limited to the portions stated above, is a violation of County Code and may result in enforcement actions to address the violation. These may include actions to abate the nonconformity, the institution of criminal, civil, or administrative actions, or, under certain circumstances, the calling of law enforcement for the removal of guests and their vehicles from the property to the extent authorized by law.

EMERGENCY 
Call 911 or sheriff at +1 (760) 366-3781
Closest Hospital - Hi Desert Medical Center, +1 (760) 366-371, 6601 White Feather Rd, Joshua Tree, CA 92252

TRASH 
Trash bins are located behind the wood fence by the trailer. Trash and Recycling pickup by Burrtec is every Thursday. Our maintenance will take out the bins in the morning and will put them back later in the day. 

CHIMINEA
Keep chiminea away from combustible material. Ash must be watered and stored in the fire proof ash can which is located next to the outdoor bench. The lid must remain on the trash can while in use.

UTILITY CONNECTIONS
Main Electricity breaker: Exterior West wall of Guest bedroom; Spa Breaker: On low wall at spa; Water: Exterior North wall; Gas: At the tank near the trailer

description:
The Joshua Tree Green Haus is a beautiful secluded vacation retreat located on a mesa overlooking the Joshua Tree National Park.
Enjoy an amazing 180 degree view of the National Park, Mt. San Jacinto and Mt. Gorgonio as well as the spectacular night sky while soaking in our outdoor cedar hot tub. The house is surrounded by untouched rocky Mojave desert terrain perfect for hiking and exploring.

The space
The home is the work of the Architects, Inverse Project, and was recently included in Vogue Travel's 'Inspiring Desert Retreats', Dwell Magazine's 'Ultimate Joshua Tree Airbnb's' and Architectural Digests 'The 7 Best Airbnbs in Palm Springs'.

The retreat is a 2 bedroom, 1 ½ bathroom house sleeping 2-6. The master bedroom has a king size bed, a large counter height work surface for the creative and a lounge seat next to the large window overlooking the valley. The second bedroom has a queen size bed and enjoys a quiet view of our rock garden and private outdoor area. The living room has a comfortable queen size pull out sofa bed. Families are very welcome. We provide a pack'n play and high seat for the smallest guests.
Pets are welcome to our home for a 25 Dollar pet fee.

Go for a hike from the house up to Bartlet Mountain or just relax, read a book from our library or play some games with friends or kids.
The retreat is equipped with indoor and outdoor spas. Either soak with your friends and/ or family enjoying the view or just relax by candle light indoors.

It comes with a BBQ and an outdoor chimenea on a spacious two level outdoor terrace for dining under the stars, sunbathing or stargazing.
WIFI is provided.
It’s only a short drive to the Park, Town of Joshua Tree and Yucca Valley as well as to Pioneer Town and to the Integratron. The Joshua Tree Retreat Center is just down the road.
Nestled in a hill at the end of a quiet residential street the Joshua Tree Green Haus offers relaxation as well as a great location for exploring the park and other attractions in and around the Park.

Guest access
The whole house will be open to you. Only a part of the closet is closed for our own use.

Registration number
CESTRP-2020-00328

description:
The ultimate desert "get away from it all" destination. Set on 480 acres and surrounded by public land. Your nearest neighbor is 3 miles away, but you're only 6 miles away from the City of Ridgecrest, CA, a Gateway to Death Valley. The Pods are completely off-grid, but with modern amenities. Use the pods as a convenient stop between Death Valley, Tahoe/Mammoth Mountain and the California Coastal cities.

The space
You get the whole place to yourselves when you stay.

Designed for indoor/outdoor living, the space is small and intimate, meant to celebrate the stark desert environment. You feel the intensity of the sun and wind, hear it when it rains, and experience the quiet solitude of the dark, starry sky; all from the comfort of your Air conditioned or heated Pod. And when it's great weather, turn off the heat or AC and open the widow walls to create the conditions of sleeping outside, but with a roof.

A great experience for families and kids of all ages.

house_rules.aditional:
We request that if you want to book our place, to please read our house rules / rental agreement below carefully and confirm that you can agree to this during your stay. If you do not have time to read through this information, or do not like following rules or instructions, or if you do not respond to messages, then please book another place. 

We find that being clear about these rules up front creates a harmonious and positive experience for our guests and for us as hosts. It is important to us to make sure our place is a good fit for your stay before we approve any reservations. Having these guidelines is what allows us to feel comfortable continuing to offer our home as a vacation rental to our wonderful guests. We fully understand, accept, and respect that our place and the way we do things is not a fit for everyone. 

-Adults only please

-No outside guests are permitted without checking with us first. 

-We request that our guests download the Airbnb app on their phones and make sure notifications are turned on so we can easily reach you and communicate before and during your stay if needed. Please be respectful of our time and respond to any questions that we send you promptly (within 24 hours.) We always do our best to respond quickly to our guests. 

-You have your own private backyard complete with swimming pool, tiki bar, sauna, and outdoor shower, and outdoor bathtub for two. This is a great place to stay if you want a luxurious relaxing vacation however, keep in mind this is not a party house. If you want to be able to be loud and yell and party in the backyard without regard for the noise volume of your group, this property is definitely not a fit, as we need to be respectful of our wonderful neighbors and our vacation rental permit and county rules. Noise from vacation rentals is a very contentious topic in our area with neighbors so please be respectful. 

We like to be very clear about this up front so there are no misunderstandings later during your stay. Lounging, relaxing, laughing and talking by the pool during the day in a normal voice is welcomed. Quiet hours are 9:30 pm to 7 am. At night, please do not stay in the pool house / tiki bar / shower area / backyard talking past 9:30 pm, our neighbors go to bed early and sleep with their windows open. Our neighborhood is extremely quiet at night, so any sound from the backyard travels easily. 

-Please do not play music in the backyard or pool house, and if our neighbors can hear your music playing from inside the house, then it is too loud. There is a county wide ordinance that there can be no amplified music (including boom boxes and speakers on phones) outdoors at any vacation rentals in Sonoma at any time. 

-Reservation is for 2 people, 2 additional guests can be added for $50 per person per night up to a max of 4 people. Please be honest and do not try to sneak extra guests or pets into our home without asking us ahead of time. Please tell us at the time of your reservation if you are planning to bring a pet or not. 

-Please always close the hideaway screen doors when leaving the French doors open downstairs, otherwise, a lot of flying insects will get into the house and are difficult and time consuming to catch afterwards and they may bother you during your stay as well if they are indoors (mosquitos, flies, wasps, etc).

-Please leave curtains open part of the day so our plants can get some light. 

-No candles or flames on the property. Electric candles are provided. 

-We are an eco-friendly property and some of our guests are sensitive to strong perfumes so please refrain from using synthetic perfumes or cologne during your stay, unless they are all natural or made from essential oils - we love that stuff!

-We are messy eaters ourselves, so if you want to eat or drink on the white sofas, please cover the sofas with the linen sofa covers provided first. If you stain the sofa and we need to remove and bleach the white slipcovers after your stay, we charge an extra $75 for our cleaner’s time to do so. Please pre-treat any stains you create on the sofa with the stain remover in the laundry closet. If you want to wash them yourself while you are there to avoid the extra cleaning charge, please message us for instructions on how to do this. 

-Please only use the black wash cloths provided to remove make-up, do not use the white towels for make-up removal or to wipe up spills. There are "work" towels in the laundry closet on top of the washing machine, feel free to get those as dirty and stained as you wish. 

-No smoking is permitted anywhere on the property or in front of property or backyard. Many of our neighbors are sensitive to cigarette smoke so if you wish to smoke please do so off property. Light cannabis use is ok in the backyard. 

-We do allow commercial photo and video shoots, but only if they are specifically approved, so please inquire if interested and tell us about your project, otherwise, no photo or video shoots permitted. 

-If you are coming for your wedding and plan to have anyone come to the house, please discuss with us first. 

-Please notify us if something gets broken even if it is something small, so we know to replace it, and please let us know if you notice something is not working properly during your stay or if something gets stained. 

-Check in is 3:00 pm. Check out is by 11:00 am sharp. Note that we are almost always booked solid, so we are not able to accommodate early check in or late check out requests. If by rare chance there is not a guest the night before your arrival, we will let you know automatically if you can check in early. Otherwise, please adhere to check in and check out times above. We always text guests as soon as the cleaners are done on day of arrival to let you know if you can come a little bit earlier. We are always happy to welcome you early if we can. 

-Guests acknowledge the following: 
1. That the pool is solar heated only and therefore only works well when it is very hot out from late May to early September depending on the weather. The pool is operational in the winter/ spring/ fall, but it is not heated at all and will be cold. In the summer, we have the solar turned all the way up and can not make it more warm than it is. We do have two pool floats that allow you to float in your clothes and not touch the water, these are great for cooler months. 
2. There is no outdoor grill at this property due to fire hazards. (There is a great indoor grill on top of the fridge) 
3. This property is located within a neighborhood (which is normally very quiet and is on a dead end street) however, occasionally neighbors may be working on their house, someone may be doing landscaping, children might be playing on the street, etc and that we as hosts can not control normal neighborhood noise that may happen during your stay. 
4. The house is on a well, so you may notice a slight sulfur smell in the water sometimes, we do have a robust $12K whole house water filter, and an additional reverse osmosis drinking water filter but if you are not used to well water, you may still notice a slight well water smell sometimes. The outdoor irrigation is not filtered and comes straight from the well, so you may notice the sulfur smell being stronger in the backyard when the irrigation is running. 
5. We have a two person outdoor bathtub. (Not a hot tub as listed in amenities, Airbnb told us to check the hot tub amenity but disclose it is a bathtub not a hot tub in our listing)

-Pool Rules
• Swim at your own risk. Guests assume all liability and responsibility for use of the pool. 
• For your safety, no diving in the pool
• No Glass in backyard area pool /shower/ bathtub area (use plastic glasses above the stove) 
• No Swimming if intoxicated
• Please do not leave pool floats on the ground as the dirt will stain them and please do not drag them across the dirt/ground when taking them out of the pool.
• Please use the seagrass mat at the pool steps to wipe of the decomposed granite/gravel from your feet before entering the pool. 

-Sauna Rules
• Use sauna at your own risk. Guests assumes all liability and responsibility for use of sauna. 
• Do not use sauna while intoxicated. 
• Drink plenty of water and do not stay in longer then 20 minutes at a time. 
• Only use grey towels inside sauna while using the sauna. (do not use white towels from the bathroom) Wash and dry grey sauna sweat towels on hot cycle after using. (Pool towels are in the black cabinet in the kitchen and also in the pool house in the summer. You can use any of the towels you wish for the outdoor shower or bathtub) 

-Our home has an entrance video ring camera floodlight for added security and to assist our guests in check in if needed.

**WOW holy smokes that was a lot of rules! If you got this far and all sounds good and you still want to stay here, then yay, you are exactly the kind of guest we want to host! Now it’s time to relax and enjoy your vacation! 🌞

....Oh wait, if you want to bring a pet take a breath and keep reading...you are almost done!.....
_________________________________________________________

PET RULES
(you only need to review this section if you want to bring a pet with you) 

-We love dogs! We know ourselves how hard it is to find vacation rentals that allow pets. So we decided to allow pets for now but with some conditions. Please inquire about any pets you are interested in bringing. Well behaved, quiet, mellow, fully potty trained pets will be considered. When you email us, please tell us about your pet and confirm you have read and agree to the house and pet rules around bringing a pet with you. 

-If you have high energy rambunctious dogs or a puppy, so sorry but this is not the right place for you. (Large mellow dogs are fine though) 

-**Very Important** Please walk your dog to go potty before letting them in the backyard and do not let them use the backyard area as a bathroom. There is a beautiful dog walking path one block from the cottage or you can walk them down to the street to the right out the front door, or you can just let them do a quick pee on the tree just outside the front door before letting them into the backyard each time. 

We have had issues with this and will have to stop allowing dogs if guests do not respect this house rule. If your dog does have an accident in the backyard, please pick it up, use the pet spray in the laundry closet and hose it down with water. If we see or smell urine or dog poop in the backyard after your stay, we will charge an additional $100 cleaning fee. We have a small backyard and it is not an appropriate area for dogs to use as a bathroom as it starts to smell very quickly. If you are not able to stop them from going to the bathroom in the backyard then please keep them inside. Thank you.

-No dogs are allowed in the pool at anytime. If you know your dog is a water dog and you can't keep them out of the pool, then this is not the right house to stay at. When dogs go into the pool, it brings a lot of decomposed granite into the pool and our pool cleaners won’t clean it out because it takes too much time and it scratches our hardwood floors too. For your dog's safety, please do not leave your dog unattended in the backyard with the pool. Dogs who are not familiar with pools can accidentally fall into them. 

-Pets must be free of fleas. 

-Please trim your dogs nails before arrival so they do not scratch the hardwood floors. 

-We require that the white sofas are covered with the provided linen covers if you bring pets because we know how our own dogs can be rough on a white sofa. As long as the sofa and bed covers are on, dogs are welcome to sit on the furniture. (We automatically put on the linen covers for you before your arrival if you are bringing a pet.) Please put a work towel down on any outdoor furniture before letting your dog get onto any of the furniture in the tiki bar. 

-If you want to leave your pet alone in the cottage and have done this a lot without any issues, this is ok please but please keep your cell phone on you and your airbnb messages notifications turned on so we can reach you if needed. Dogs must be quiet and not be constantly barking.

-If you go on a walk and it is muddy or raining, please wipe your dogs feet at the door. We will provide wipes for you in the hallway under the bench.

-Please make sure your dog is friendly and on a leash during walks, we have a lot of other friendly dogs in the neighborhood and want to make sure everyone gets along during your stay. 

-If there is any damage caused by your pet, you will be required to pay for it. If you have a dog who has has accidents in the house please use doggy diapers, otherwise you will be charged for anything that is damaged. 

-We require a one time pet cleaning fee of $50 per pet per stay. 

-Please note: Two indoor dog beds as well as an outdoor dog bed are provided. Dog bowls are also provided.

location_descriptions.title: Neighbourhood highlights
location_descriptions.content:
Located in the quiet and safe residential neighborhood of Graton. Graton is a small town filled with artists and environmentally minded people. We have very friendly neighbors. Some of our immediate neighbors are: metal sculpture artist, florist, pottery artist, textile artist and painter, photographer, animal activist, jewelry maker, montessori teacher, butterfly cultivator, art gallery manager, solar power business owner, shaman, backyard farmers and homesteaders, well you get the idea:)

Please note that the town of Graton is located in a rural setting, but the cottage itself is in a residential neighborhood with neighbors close by. Most of the time the neighborhood is very quiet and we live on a dead end street, but occasionally a neighbor may have a gathering during the day (extremely rare), or someone may be doing some construction or repair work on their house, kids may be playing, or someone may be doing landscaping, etc. In other words, there are direct close neighbors so if you are looking for a remote rural property that is silent with no neighbors this is not it.

Please be aware that we live in a rural area. You may hear crickets or even frogs at night. You may see squirrels jumping in trees next to the house. You may see wild turkeys, quail, deer, bats, hawks, or even an owl here and there either down on the nature trail or just walking down the street. You may see a beautiful red dragonfly drinking from the pool, ladybugs or even a spider or hummingbird on occasion in the backyard. In the spring, summer, or fall you may see some paper wasps (not aggressive unless they are attacked) or bees here and there on plants or flying around in the backyard and in the surrounding neighborhood. Leave them alone and they will leave you alone, we have never been stung the whole time we have lived here and a guest has never been stung either. If you are allergic though, you should stay elsewhere to be safe.

We regularly check for paper wasp nests in the summer and get rid of them Immediately but if you are in this west county area you may still see some flying around here and there outside in the summer. We do go to great lengths to do everything we can to control them on our property but obviously we can never be totally in control of nature. If you are someone that needs a 100% controlled environment without any of these "nature" elements, then please find a different property that is more suitable to your needs. Also, please remember to look up and enjoy the stars at night, they are bigger and brighter here!

The cottage is located in the heart of it all. Countless wineries / vineyards in the area to go wine tasting. Five minute walk to downtown Graton restaurants such as The Underwood, and Willowood. Five minute walk to the fabulous Bowman Cellars Wine Tasting Room which is three blocks away. Red Car and Dutton and many other great wineries are a quick five minute drive from the cottage.

Five minute drive to the Barlow and the town of Sebastopol. Five minutes to Forestville. Ten minutes to Occidental. Fifteen minute drive to Guerneville. Ten minutes to Russian River. 20 minute drive to the beach (Bodega Bay) 25 minutes to Healdsburg (take the back way, very pretty drive).

location_descriptions.title: Getting around
location_descriptions.content: Downtown Graton restaurant and bars and wine tasting room are a five minute walk from the cottage. There is a paved bike / walking trail right behind the cottage that goes to Forestville, and Sebastopol. Uber and Lyft are also available here as well.

description:
**Very Important** Please read description below and “Other things to note” at the bottom of this section before contacting us.
• Adults Only
• Private Sunny 1 Bedroom, 2 full bathroom 900 sq ft stand alone home
• Private Backyard with Pool, Sauna, Outdoor Shower, and Outdoor Bathtub
• Luxurious Modern Farmhouse Style
• Created to feel like a boutique hotel experience
• In the heart of wine country Sebastopol/ West Sonoma
• Eco-Friendly products used
• Strict covid cleaning protocols

The space
If you are interested in booking our place, please provide the requested info from “Other things to note” at the bottom of this section and use “Contact Host” button in "hosted by Trinette+Chris" section to contact us, please do not use “Reserve” button. We have guidelines that need to be discussed prior to confirming any reservations, so please review this info before contacting us.

You belong here. Our home is an inclusive safe space for all. We welcome guests of all races, faiths, genders, and sexual orientations. BIPOC and LGTBQIA+ friendly home. Feel free to let us know your pronoun preferences when you message us. We welcome guests into our home who believe in inclusivity and equality.

Our cottage is professionally cleaned from top to bottom between each guest, windows are kept open during cleaning and if weather permits windows can be left open for arrival as well for additional ventilation. We have an Levoit HEPA air filter running upstairs and a Rabbit Air HEPA air filter with germ defense filters running downstairs upon your arrival. Our cleaners sanitize surfaces and wear masks and gloves during cleaning.

**About Our Space**

• A private sanctuary to relax , rest, and rejuvenate.

• Sensorial interior design curated to feel like a luxury boutique hotel experience and make you feel pampered.

• Private Backyard and Private Solar Heated Swimming Pool with Pool Floats (Pool is not heated in the winter, solar heat can only work when it is very warm out from late May to September depending on weather) We do have pool floats that allow you to float in your clothes and not touch the water. These can be used to float in the pool in the cooler months when the pool is too cold to swim in.

• Italian designed Clearlight Full Spectrum Far Infrared ultra low emf outdoor 4 person sauna and outdoor shower.

• Outdoor Bathtub for two (no hot tub)

• High speed gigabit internet with internet connection in the backyard and Tiki Bar as well. Works great for zoom calls and streaming. Two laptop desks to work from sofa or bed.

• Air Conditioning throughout, ceiling fan in bedroom, extra fan in closet if needed

• King Size Luxury Eco-Friendly Non Toxic Memory Foam Mattress from Saatva in master bedroom with Serena and Lily Canopy Bed.

• All natural bedding materials with 100% Belgian linen sheets, Egyptian cotton gauze blanket, Australian all natural wool comforter inside linen duvet cover.

• Pillow Bar Menu - Luxury Hotel Collection King Size Pillows from Northern Feather Canada on the bed. Multiple other pillow options available in closet: Feather and Down Pillows, King Size Shredded Latex Pillows, Contoured Organic Latex Memory Foam Pillows from Three Happy Coconuts, and Two hypoallergenic pillows.

• Luxurious Turkish Cotton Waffle Robes from Parachute Home (see link on our Farmhouse Oasis website to purchase)

• Queen size sleeper sofa in living room with upgraded memory foam mattress. (Cottage Sleeps max of 4 people total, 2 people included in reservation, $50 extra per person up to max of 4 people)

• Eco-friendly non toxic paint used throughout

• Eco-friendly cleaning and non toxic / laundry products, and amenities used throughout property

• Whole house water filtration system as well as five stage reverse osmosis drinking filter in kitchen, filter is changed on schedule every six months.

• Washer and dryer

• Levoit HEPA Air Filter upstairs and a Rabbit Air HEPA filter with Germ Defense filtration downstairs. White Noise Machine for bedroom and an extra Austin Hepa filter if needed (kept in bedroom closet if you want to use it)

• Real European Oak hardwood floors throughout, Italian tile in upstairs bathroom, pebble tile in downstairs bathroom

• 2 Full Bathrooms, one with clawfoot bathtub only, and the other one with shower only

• Hello Tushy Bidet’s in both bathrooms (use discount code FARMHOUSEOASIS to receive 10% off if you want to purchase one for your own house, see our Farmhouse Oasis website for link).

• 55 inch HD 4K Smart TV in Living Room with Monscierge Apple TV service with streaming access to Netflix, Amazon Prime Video, Spotify, HBO, Hulu, Etc. Our Apple TV automatically signs you out of all streaming services upon checkout.

• Complimentary fresh organic coffee with french press and pour over coffee maker, as well as an assortment of Organic Tea. Cane sugar, organic honey, and organic stevia provided as well.

• Kitchen is stocked with organic olive oil, organic balsamic, organic coconut oil, salt, pepper, and some basic spices.

• Botanical and biodegradable natural shampoo and conditioner provided, all natural handmade local soaps and bath salts provided, as well as aromatherapy essential oils

• Heat throughout as well as a Dimplex steam Opti-myst electric fireplace stove in living room

• Fully Equipped Kitchen with Big Chill appliances and gas stove. Stainless steel, cast iron, and healthy non toxic non stick ceramic cookware

• Healthy ceramic indoor grill and waffle maker from Green Pan. (We can not have an outdoor grill because of fire hazards and not enough wood clearance.)

• Well behaved, quiet, trained pets considered if certain requirements are met, please see pet rules and inquire first.

• Fully enclosed private backyard with tiki bar and hammock and lounge area

• Two off street parking spaces - there is an electrical outlet on the front of the house where you park your car if you have an electric car, feel free to use that plug.

• Beautiful paved nature walking path right behind the cottage one block away, Joe Rodota Trail for biking, walking the dog, or just going for a relaxing stroll. Trail goes to Forestville in one direction, and Sebastopol in the other direction.

• Countless wineries / vineyards in the area to go wine tasting. There are actually two wine tasting rooms within walking distance a few blocks away and many more are a 2 to 5 minute drive from the cottage. Bowman Cellars tasting room is literally a three block walk from the cottage. (See area for more info) There are two restaurants within walking distance as well.

• Please make sure you click on the location tab to read more about the location and neighborhood.

• Our home has an entrance video ring camera floodlight for added security and to assist our guests in check in if needed.

• We are fully permitted in Sonoma County as a vacation rental and we pay all required occupancy taxes and fees to the county. TOT#2897N

• Search for Farmhouse Oasis Sebastopol online for more detailed info.

Guest access
Entire private home with private backyard, private pool, and private sauna, and private tiki bar. Paved nature walking and biking path behind cottage, restaurants and wine tasting room within walking distance.

Other things to note
If you would like for us to consider your reservation, please provide the following information to us when you message us. Please use the “Contact Host” button in the "Hosted by Trinette+Chris" section of our listing to contact us, please do NOT use the “Reserve” button. We need to make sure you are a good fit for us to host before offering you a reservation. (You can copy the 4 Questions below and paste them into the message to us if this is easier.)

1. Let us know a little about yourself, where will you be traveling from when you come to stay here, and what brings you to the area. (If you are new to Airbnb and do not have any reviews, please make sure your profile is filled out).

House Rules are now located at the bottom of listings, you have to click on “show more” to read our additional house rules/ rental agreement. There is important info in there that we need you to agree to before we can offer you a reservation. Please read this info before contacting us.

This is a great house if you are looking for a quiet, relaxing, and luxurious experience, it is not the right house for you if you are looking to be loud or party, or don’t like reading or following rules.

location_descriptions.title: Neighbourhood highlights
location_descriptions.content:
Tucked between Downtown Santa Barbara and the Pacific Ocean, there are endless reasons why "The Mesa" is Santa Barbara's favorite part of town. Water lovers can enjoy quick access to beautiful beaches, and some of the most scenic islands in California are just a short boat ride away. Hikers will find endless trails with towering views of the Pacific. Add since the Mesa is only 2 miles from Downtown Santa Barbara, you're only moments away from world-class fine dining, nightlife, trendy eateries, fantastic shopping destinations, and the beautiful Mediterranean-style architecture of the city. Come visit our Beach cottage and you’ll quickly understand why "The Mesa" in Santa Barbara is so beloved by locals and travelers around the globe.

If you’re an outdoor lover, here are 9 ways that you can get the most out of Santa Barbara getaway while visiting our Beach Cottage on The Mesa.

1) THE DOUGLAS PRESERVE! (A must see)

The best view in Santa Barbara! This beautiful, undeveloped open space has numerous trails and is a hugely popular place for walking dogs because they are allowed off leash. The bluff-top oceanfront position of the park is a great location to watch for whales and dolphins. This large open-space that was donated to the city of Santa Barbara sits above Hendry's Beach Features: Alcohol Allowed, Biking, Hiking Trail, Parking On Street, Passive Open Spaces, Views, Wildlife and Birding

2) THE BEACH!

A day at the beach doesn’t necessarily mean just lying around—although there’s nothing wrong with that. Santa Barbara has a wide variety of beaches to suit many moods - but non are better than the beaches on The Mesa near our Beach Cottage! Leadbetter Beach is the hot spot for surfing, boogie boarding, and swimming - Just a 5 minute walk from our house! While the west-facing Butterfly Beach may be the best place to watch a sunset. If you want to get in a game of volleyball, East Beach is the place to be. It also offers bike rentals, playgrounds, cafes, and other beach amenities. Do you have dogs??? Arroyo Burro Beach is a dog-friendly beach on the Mesa that’s an excellent beachcombing spot.


3) SURFING!

Santa Barbara features some of the best surf breaks in the world, which is why many of the top names in the sport make the town their home. You can watch the top dogs in action or take to the waves yourself. Rincon Point, known in the surf community as the "Queen of the Coast," features waves that travel for up to half a mile. Leadbetter Point (a short walk from our Beach Cottage) features smaller breakers just west of Santa Barbara Harbor and is perfect for those just learning the sport. Campus Point at the University of California is another mellower spot for visitors to get up on a board and become a part of that famous surf culture.

4) SHORELINE PARK!

Just a 5 minute walk from our Beach Cottage! Amazing! Enjoy the most beautiful and peaceful setting right on the ocean with views of the mountains and the city. Plenty of picnic tables and lots of space to walk, skate or run.

5) CYCLING!

Cycling is a great way to explore The Santa Barbara. Bring your bike and enjoy comfortable beach cruises or challenge yourself by traveling through the mountains. One of the most iconic climbs for road cyclists in Southern California is Gibraltar, a nine mile ride that features more than 3,000 feet of climbing. Local cyclists refer to it as the Alpe d’Huez of Santa Barbara, recalling the famous mountain stage of the Tour de France. Mountain bikers have lots of options when it comes to going off-road. Stay on The Mesa and explore Elings Park, which features about five miles of singletrack trails that are perfect for beginners. Serious riders will want to check out Jesusita and its 7 miles of trails in the mountains just outside of town. Be prepared for long climbs and some technical section of trail. Want a more relaxed ride? Visit the Mesa's favorite ocean-view park - Shoreline Park!

6) STAND-UP PADDLEBOARDING!

You won’t find a more scenic place to stand up on the water than The Mesa in Santa Barbara. Both the Santa Barbara Adventure Company and Cal Coast Adventures offer both rentals and lessons at several area beaches. (They can also help with rentals/lessons for kayaking and surfing as well.) One of the post popular spots is Santa Barbara Harbor, which features calm waters and sandy beaches. After your ride, stop by the Chuck’s Waterfront Grill or the Shoreline Beach Cafe for a well-earned meal.

7) GOLF!

Santa Barbara features three spectacular golf courses that are among the most scenic in the country. The Robert Trent Jones Jr.-designed Rancho San Marcos sits in the valley of the Santa Ynez Mountains amid century-old oaks and historic ranch buildings. The Glen Annie Golf Club is in the foothills just outside the city. The front nine holes feature lakes and water hazards while the back nine on the mountain feature ocean and channel views. Finally the Sandpiper Golf Club, named by Golf Digest as one of the top 100 public courses in the country, features a links-style course with ocean and mountain views on every hole.

8) SAILING!

Let the wind do the work while you enjoy the views while out on a sailboat. Start at Santa Barbara Harbor and you’ll be able to explore the coastline, the Santa Barbara Channel and the Channel Islands National Park. Regular northwest winds make this an excellent spot both novice boaters and experienced sailors. Santa Barbara Sailing offers both instruction as well as private and public cruises. From mid-February to mid-May, take a whale-watching cruise to spot the majestic Pacific Gray Whales.

9) SANTA BARBARA BOTANIC GARDENS!

Just a short drive from The Mesa! Get to know more about the area’s plant life at the Santa Barbara Botanic Gardens. You’ll find more than 1,000 different native California plants in this 78 acre preserve that’s also a world-class center for research. You can take docent-led tour to find out more, or simply enjoy the hiking everything from cool Redwood forests to sandy desert terrain on your own.

description:
Newly remodeled 3b/3ba home with spa - located 2 blocks from the beach! This luxurious coastal get-away boasts high end-finishes and stunning outdoor spaces. Incredible location only .2 miles (5 min walking distance) from Leadbetter Beach & Shoreline Park, and only 2 miles from Downtown. Enjoy modern appliances, quartz countertops, remodeled bathrooms w/ marble floors, smart TV, beach cruiser bikes on site, a flagstone patio w/ lush tropical landscaping, BBQ & spa! Pet friendly!($250 pet fee)

The space
LOVELY OUTDOOR SPACES:

The exterior of the home boasts stained Brazilian Ipe wood, lush tropical landscaping, and a stunning flagstone patio with outdoor furniture - perfect for enjoying the beautiful Santa Barbara weather. Not to mention a 6 person jetted spa! All set beneath lovely string lights which cast a romantic ambiance.

REMODELED KITCHEN:

This open floor plan kitchen is bathed in natural sunlight and is equipped with quartz countertops, stunning tile backsplash, and farmhouse sink. Enjoy abundant pots, pans, glassware, dishware, silverware, an array of spices and seasonings, and a beautiful 30" stainless steel gas range to fulfill all of your cooking desires.

COZY LIVING ROOM:

French doors open from the living room to the stunning flagstone patio - creating the perfect indoor/outdoor flow. The living room receives incredible natural light and opens to the dining area, which lends itself to a perfect open floor plan. Enjoy the 65" Smart TV loaded with Netflix and Youtube TV. All set beneath a pitched ceiling with beachy wood paneling.


COMFORTABLE BEDROOMS + PULL OUT COUCH IN LIVING ROOM

Two bedrooms have an ensuite bathroom, while the third bedroom is right outside a full bathroom in the hallway - so every bedroom has their own private bathroom with shower. All bedroom have high end mattresses from Sit & Sleep and memory foam pillows, to ensure you will rest comfortably. The bedrooms have all new windows, new floors, and new recessed lighting. Brand new stackable Samsung washer/dryer in unit at your disposal :)
If you need a 4th sleeping area, the living room couch pulls out to a queen size mattress. Please remember - max capacity is 6 guests.

NEWLY REMODELED BATHROOMS:

Remodeled to perfection with new marble/tile floors, newly tiled shower, new vanities, new toilets, new everything :) We pack our bathrooms with shampoo, soaps, blow dryer, body wash, and lush luxury towels and hand towels - everything you need for a perfect experience.

Parking:
One spot in driveway. There’s also free parking on gravel area outside house, but this is public parking so first come first serve.

Guest access
The entire home and all outdoor spaces.

Other things to note
We have a complimentary spa cleaning service 2-3 times per week to keep our hot tub clean for all our guests. Our spa cleaners will be accessing the property for around 15 minutes twice a week and you may see them during your stay. Since the spa cleaner works on a unique schedule, he does not always give us a heads-up before visiting the property. So please note the spa cleaner may access the property (exterior only) to clean the spa without prior consent or warning.

description:
Inhale. Exhale.

Relax in this cozy, romantic guesthouse retreat nestled in the redwoods of the Santa Cruz Mountains, overlooking the bay and conveniently located near the famous Alice’s Restaurant on Skyline Blvd in Woodside. The 1 acre gated property has ample parking and privacy. Snuggle in with the wood burning fireplace, prepare meals in the full size kitchen and take in the views of the majestic redwoods right outside the windows with bay views peeking through the trees.

The space
We welcome you to relax with us at our magical hillside location above the fray of the valley while having many conveniences nearby.

This 2 bedroom guest house occupies the upper level of our fully detached garage with separate entrance, providing comfortable living space and dramatic views. Whether a staycation or a vacation, refresh and renew in the fresh air and temperate climate of the California redwoods. It’s also perfect for longer stays and those working remotely who wish to enjoy a change of scenery and feel a thousand miles away while only a 20 minute drive to Silicon Valley and all it has to offer.

There is a walking trail around the property and a lower deck with a fire pit that’s excellent for enjoying morning coffee or afternoon cocktails.

Jeff (he/him) and HiC (he/him/they/them) offer a safe space that respects diversity and inclusion. We welcome guests from all minority and marginalised groups, all races, faiths, genders, and sexual orientations.

Other things to note
• Walking distance to famous Alice’s Restaurant, a small deli/market, and gas stations
• 7 minutes to a winery (many more within 30-45mins)
• 10 minutes to downtown Woodside markets and restaurants
• 15 minutes to Hwy 280
• 25 mins to the coast and beaches
• 25 mins to Stanford University and Palo Alto
• 30 mins to Half Moon Bay (kayaking, surfing, horseback riding, restaurants)
• Several open space preserves within 10 miles or less offering fabulous trails for hiking, biking, and views of the ocean and bay

We also offer customized experiences such as a personalized wine tour with Jeff, who is a certified sommelier, and Tarot Readings with HiC. Just enquire when booking, and we're happy to discuss your interests and desires and how we can assist you in having the most fulfilling experience possible during your stay.

description:
Welcome to Cory Cottage, your private oasis in the heart of San Jose! Located less than a mile from Santana Row and Santa Clara University, this modern and stylish cottage is the perfect getaway for anyone looking to escape the hustle and bustle of everyday life. With a gated private entry and fully equipped kitchen, you can unwind and relax in complete privacy. Whether you're traveling for business or pleasure, Cory Cottage has everything you need to make your stay comfortable and cozy.

The space
Our small yet mighty studio layout is ruthlessly functional, delivering engineering perfection in every detail. From the fully equipped kitchen, including a range, microwave, pour-over coffee station, washer/dryer, and even a dishwasher, to the living space with a Smart TV (Netflix, Amazon Prime) and Sleeper Sofa, every aspect of your stay has been crafted with your comfort and convenience in mind.

Enjoy the perfect night's sleep on our comfy queen bed, surrounded by decor from around the world, in our craftily decorated cottage. The bathroom features locally sourced body wash, shampoo, and conditioner, ensuring your stay is one of pure luxury. The closet and desk, which doubles as a dining and workstation, complete the experience, providing everything you need for a relaxing and productive stay.

Experience the ultimate in privacy and exclusivity at Cory Cottage, with a private, gated entrance, keypad entry, and safe, on-street parking. And with a location just a stone's throw from Silicon Valley's bustling hub, you'll be perfectly placed to experience the very best of what the South Bay has to offer.

Guest access
Guest will have full access to the unit and shared access to the gated driveway leading to the cottage.

Other things to note
Owners live in the primary (main) house which is detached from the cottage. We are available most times to help in person or via the app.
